recipe.ingredients: - ground turkey: 1 pound - broccoli florets: 2 cups - carrots (sliced): 1 cup - red bell pepper (sliced): 1 - yellow onion (sliced): 1 - garlic (minced): 3 cloves - low sodium soy sauce: 2 tablespoons - sesame oil: 1 tablespoon - freshly grated ginger: 1 teaspoon - olive oil: 1 tablespoon - black pepper: 1/4 teaspoon
recipe.directions: 1. Prepare Vegetables: Wash and slice the carrots, bell pepper, and onion. Cut the broccoli into florets. 2. Cook Turkey: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the ground turkey and cook, breaking it into crumbles, until browned and cooked through. 3. Sauté Vegetables: Remove the turkey from the skillet and set aside. In the same skillet, add more olive oil if needed, then add the onion, garlic, carrots, and bell pepper. Sauté until they start to soften. 4. Combine Ingredients: Return the cooked turkey to the skillet. Add the broccoli, soy sauce, sesame oil, ginger, and black pepper. Stir well to combine. 5. Cook until Done: Continue to cook over medium heat for about 5 more minutes, or until the vegetables are tender but still crisp. 6. Serve or Store: Serve immediately or allow to cool before dividing into meal prep containers and refrigerating.
recipe.nutrition: Total Carbohydrate: 12g, Dietary Fiber: 3g, Sodium: 280mg, Saturated Fat: 1.5g, Total Fat: 14g, Protein: 24g, Added Sugars: 0g, Total Sugars: 5g
recipe.total_calories_estimation: - Total Calories for entire recipe : Approximately 964 calories for the entire recipe. - Calories for each ingredient: Ground Turkey: 640 calories for 1 pound Broccoli Florets: 62 calories for 2 cups Carrots: 50 calories for 1 cup sliced Red Bell Pepper: 37 calories Onion: 44 calories for 1 medium onion Garlic: 13 calories for 3 cloves Low Sodium Soy Sauce: 20 calories for 2 tablespoons Sesame Oil: 40 calories for 1 tablespoon Ginger: Negligible Olive Oil: 119 calories per 1 tablespoon Black Pepper: Negligible - Serving People: 4
